transcript: I was 22. I had done everything that my dad had wanted me to do at this point and so I started driving across the country I called him when I was like halfway across the United States and I was like I'm going to California I'm gonna open a gym I'm gonna get into fitness and we didn't really talk much for a long time I knew that he just wanted me to be a doctor that's what he was that would have been his dream it wasn't enough and I knew that and so I knew that the choice for me was that I either had to die to him or I had to die to myself because people say it's Society it's other people it's usually one or two voices are you willing to sacrifice your dreams are you willing to sacrifice a certain amount of influence that your family has over them I felt like I had to let my dad's dream die from mine to live foreign
